ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
I have known this person for many years
Notes: 0 = Definitely false or strongly disagree; 1 = Mostly false or disagree; 2 = About equally true or false, cannot decide, or neutral; 3 = Mostly true or agree; 4 = Definitely true or strongly agree

ElementDescription: Personal Acquaintance Measure (PAM) Total Score
Notes: Sum the scores associated with all the items. Note that items 5, 8, and 12 are reverse scored

ElementDescription: PAM Duration Subscore
Notes: Sum the scores associated with items 1, 3, and 13

ElementDescription: PAM Frequency of Interaction Subscore
Notes: Sum the scores associated with items 6, 15, and 17

ElementDescription: PAM Knowledge of Goals Subscore
Notes: Sum the scores associated with items 7, 9, and 18

ElementDescription: PAM Physical Intimacy Subscore
Notes: Sum the scores associated with items 2, 11, and 16

ElementDescription: PAM Self-Disclosure Subscore
Notes: Sum the scores associated with items 5, 8, and 12. Note that these items are reverse scored

ElementDescription: PAM Social Network Familiarity Subscore
Notes: Sum the scores associated with items 4, 10, and 14
